Alopecosa.label: Alopecosa
Alopecosa.description:
Alopecosa is a spider genus in the family Lycosidae, with about 140 species and several subspecies.
Most species grow up to 2 cm. Alopecosa females make a burrow in which they deposit their egg sac. Wikipedia

Argasidae.label: Argasidae
Argasidae.description: The Argasidae are a family of ticks containing the soft ticks. They lack the hard scutum present in the hard ticks. The capitulum is located on the underside of the animal's body and is not readily visible. Wikipedia

Argiope (spider).label: Argiope
Argiope (spider).description: The genus Argiope includes rather large and spectacular spiders that often have a strikingly coloured abdomen. These spiders are distributed throughout the world. Wikipedia

Avicularia.label: Avicularia
Avicularia.description: Avicularia is a genus of the family Theraphosidae containing various species of tarantulas. The genus is native to tropical South America. Each species in the genus has very distinguishable pink foot pads. Wikipedia

Bolas spiders.label: Bolas spiders
Bolas spiders.description: Bolas Spiders are unusual orb-weaver spiders that do not spin the typical web. Instead, they hunt by using a sticky 'capture blob' of silk on the end of a line, known as a 'bolas'. Wikipedia

Chilean rose tarantula.label: Chilean rose tarantula
Chilean rose tarantula.description: The Rose Hair Tarantula, also known in the United States as the Chilean rose tarantula, Chilean flame tarantula, Chilean fire tarantula or the Chilean red-haired tarantula, is probably the most common ... Wikipedia

Drassodes.label: Drassodes
Drassodes.description: Drassodes is a spider genus in the family Gnaphosidae. They can reach a length of about 20mm; the brownish spiders live under rocks or bark in mostly dry habitats. Wikipedia

Euscorpius.label: Euscorpius
Euscorpius.description: Euscorpius is a genus of scorpions, commonly called small wood-scorpions. It presently contains 17 species and is the type genus of the family Euscorpiidae - long included in the Chactidae - and the subfamily Euscorpiinae. Wikipedia

Hydrachnidiae.label: Hydrachnidiae
Hydrachnidiae.description: Hydrachnidiae are a group of mites containing over 5,000 species found in freshwater habitat. Wikipedia

Hadrurus arizonensis.label: Hadrurus arizonensis
Hadrurus arizonensis.description: Hadrurus arizonensis, the giant desert hairy scorpion, giant hairy scorpion, or Arizona Desert hairy scorpion, is the largest scorpion in North America, and one of the 8â€“9 species of Hadrurus in the United States, attaining a length of 14 cm. Wikipedia

Ixodes ricinus.label: Ixodes ricinus
Ixodes ricinus.description: Ixodes ricinus, the castor bean tick, is a chiefly European species of hard-bodied tick. It may reach a length of 11 mm when engorged with a blood meal, and can transmit both bacterial and viral pathogens ... Wikipedia

Meta menardi.label: Meta menardi
Meta menardi.description: The European cave spider, Meta menardi, is a long-jawed orb-weaving spider it is also known as the Orbweaving cave spider, the Cave orbweaver and simply the Cave spider. Wikipedia

Mesostigmata.label: Mesostigmata
Mesostigmata.description: Mesostigmata is an order of mites belonging to the Parasitiformes. Unlike most members of that group, many of these mites are not parasitic but free-living and predatory. Wikipedia

Grammostola.label: Grammostola
Grammostola.description:
Grammostola is a genus of the tarantula family, Theraphosidae, being native to tropical South America.
These spiders are medium to large in size and usually brown in color, with pinkish or orangish-red hairs. Wikipedia

Micrommata virescens.label: Micrommata virescens
Micrommata virescens.description: The green huntsman spider is a spider with a palearctic distribution, of the huntsman spider family. M. virescens is a species occurring naturally in Northern and Central Europe, including Denmark. Wikipedia

Metellina segmentata.label: Metellina segmentata
Metellina segmentata.description:
Metellina segmentata is a spider in the Tetragnathidae family with a Palaearctic distribution. It has also been introduced to Canada.
Adults can be found from August to October. Wikipedia

Oribatida.label: Oribatida
Oribatida.description: Oribatida, also known as moss mites or beetle mites, are an order of mites, in the "chewing Acariformes" clade Sarcoptiformes. They range in size from 0.2 to 1.4 millimetres. Wikipedia

Parasitiformes.label: Parasitiformes
Parasitiformes.description: The Parasitiformes are an order of Acari. Many species are parasitic, but not all; for example, about half of the 10,000 known species in the suborder Mesostigmata are predatory and cryptozoan, living ... Wikipedia

Pisaura mirabilis.label: Pisaura mirabilis
Pisaura mirabilis.description:
The nursery web spider Pisaura mirabilis is a spider species of the family Pisauridae.
It was described in chapter 5 of the book Svenska Spindlar by the Swedish arachnologist and entomologist Carl Alexander Clerck. Wikipedia

Spider mite.label: Spider mite
Spider mite.description: Spider mites are members of the Acari family Tetranychidae, which includes about 1,200 species. They generally live on the undersides of leaves of plants, where they may spin protective silk webs, and ... Wikipedia

Tegenaria.label: Tegenaria
Tegenaria.description: House spiders of the genus Tegenaria are fast-running brownish funnel-web weavers that occupy much of the Northern Hemisphere except for Japan and Indonesia. Wikipedia

Trombicula autumnalis.label: Trombicula autumnalis
Trombicula autumnalis.description: The harvest mite, Trombicula autumnalis, is a species of mite of the family Trombiculidae. Their larvae live parasitically; they infect all domestic mammals, humans, and some ground-nesting birds. Wikipedia

Uroplectes olivaceus.label: Uroplectes olivaceus
Uroplectes olivaceus.description: Uroplectes olivaceus is a scorpion of the family Buthidae. The species are 60 mm in length, are black colored, and have fine granulations on their tails. Their venom is not deadly to humans; however, it might cause some swelling. Wikipedia

Amaurobiidae.label: Amaurobiidae
Amaurobiidae.description: The Amaurobiidae are three-clawed cribellate or ecribellate spiders found in most parts of the world and difficult to distinguish from related spiders in other families, especially Agelenidae, Desidae and Amphinectidae. Wikipedia

Aelurillinae.label: Aelurillinae
Aelurillinae.description: Aelurillinae is a subfamily of jumping spiders. Nearly all species live in the Old World, except Phlegra hentzi. Wikipedia

Amblyomma.label: Amblyomma
Amblyomma.description: Amblyomma is a genus of hard ticks. Some are disease vectors, for example for Rocky Mountain spotted fever in Brazil or ehrlichiosis and anaplasmosis in the USA. Wikipedia

Amblypygi.label: Amblypygi
Amblypygi.description: Amblypygi is an order of invertebrate animals belonging to the class Arachnida, in the subphylum Chelicerata of the phylum Arthropoda. They form a separate order of arachnids alongside the spiders, scorpions and others. Wikipedia

Araneoidea.label: Araneoidea
Araneoidea.description:
The Araneoidea are a superfamily of araneomorph spiders. They contain families of eight-eyed spiders
Anapidae
Araneidae
Cyatholipidae
Linyphiidae
Mysmenidae
Nephilidae
Nesticidae
Pimoidae
Sinopimoidae ... Wikipedia

Archaeidae.label: Archaeidae
Archaeidae.description:
The Archaeidae are a spider family with 25 described species in three genera.
Their common name pelican spider stems from their specialised anatomy they have evolved elongated chelicerae and necks for catching other spiders. Wikipedia

Chinattus.label: Chinattus
Chinattus.description: Chinattus is a genus of the spider family Salticidae. Most of the described species occur in China and nearby countries, with C. caucasicus reaching into Iran. C. parvulus is found in North America. Wikipedia

Caponiidae.label: Caponiidae
Caponiidae.description: Spiders of the ecribellate haplogyne family Caponiidae are unusual in that most species have only two eyes, which is unheard of in other spiders. Other species have four, six or eight eyes. Wikipedia

Chummidae.label: Chummidae
Chummidae.description:
The Chummidae are a tiny spider family with only two described species in one genus. Both were first described in 2001. Both species are known from males and females.
They are small, three-clawed spiders with a strong dorsal scutum. Wikipedia

Crab spider.label: Crab spider
Crab spider.description: Crab spider is a common name applied loosely to many species of spiders, but most nearly consistently to members of the family Thomisidae. Wikipedia

Crevice weaver.label: Crevice weaver
Crevice weaver.description: The crevice weaver spiders contain primitive cribellate spiders. They are haplogyne weavers of funnel or tube webs. The family contains 17 genera and more than hundred described species worldwide. Wikipedia

Cyatholipidae.label: Cyatholipidae
Cyatholipidae.description:
The Cyatholipidae are a spider family with 58 described species in 23 genera.
They were discovered in the late 19th century in Africa. Cyatholipidae live mostly in moist, montane forests. Wikipedia

Deinopidae.label: Deinopidae
Deinopidae.description: The spider family Deinopidae consists of stick-like elongate spiders that build unusual webs that they suspend between the front legs. Wikipedia

Cybaeidae.label: Cybaeidae
Cybaeidae.description: Cybaeidae is a family of spiders comprising twelve genera. Wikipedia

Dictynidae.label: Dictynidae
Dictynidae.description: Dictynidae is a family of cribellate spiders. Most spiders in this family build irregular webs close to or directly on the ground. Typically they create a tangle of silken fibers among several branches or stems of one plant. Wikipedia

Dipluridae.label: Dipluridae
Dipluridae.description: Funnel-web tarantulas, are a group of spiders in the infraorder Mygalomorphae, that have two pairs of booklungs, and chelicerae that move up and down in a stabbing motion. Wikipedia

Drymusidae.label: Drymusidae
Drymusidae.description: The Drymusidae are a small spider family with ten species in one genus. They are also called false violin spiders or leaf-litter spiders. They resemble the violin spider or recluse spider, but other than these build a web. Wikipedia

Dysderidae.label: Dysderidae
Dysderidae.description: The family Dysderidae are araneomorph spiders found primarily in Eurasia, although extending into North Africa, with very few species occurring in South America, and one introduced into many regions of the world. Wikipedia

Euophrys omnisuperstes.label: Euophrys omnisuperstes
Euophrys omnisuperstes.description: Euophrys omnisuperstes, the himalayan jumping spider, is a small jumping spider that lives at elevations of up to 6,700 metres on Mount Everest, making it a candidate for the highest known permanent resident on earth. Wikipedia

Envia garciai.label: Envia garciai
Envia garciai.description: Envia garciai is a small pale yellow species of mygalomorph spider from Brazil. It is the only described species in genus Envia. Wikipedia

Feaellidae.label: Feaellidae
Feaellidae.description: The Feaellidae are a family of pseudoscorpions with the single genus Feaella. Wikipedia

Haptopoda.label: Haptopoda
Haptopoda.description: Haptopoda is an extinct arachnid order known exclusively from only eight specimens from the Upper Carboniferous of Coseley, Staffordshire, United Kingdom. Wikipedia

Heptathela.label: Heptathela
Heptathela.description:
Heptathela is a genus of spiders that includes the Kimura-gumo. They are basal trapdoor spiders of the family Liphistiidae and are found in Japan, China, and Southeast Asia.
Females are up to 25 mm long, males slightly smaller. Wikipedia

Idiopidae.label: Idiopidae
Idiopidae.description: Idiopidae are a mygalomorph spider family. They have a large body that often looks rather like a tarantula. Wikipedia

Jumping spider.label: Jumping spider
Jumping spider.description: The jumping spider family contains more than 500 described genera and about 5,000 described species, making it the largest family of spiders with about 13% of all species. Wikipedia

Kimura-gumo.label: Kimura-gumo
Kimura-gumo.description: The kimura-gumo or kimura spider is an Old World spider, found primarily in Japan and named after Arika Kimura, who discovered it in 1920. It belongs to the sub-order Mesothelae and can reach up to 3 cm in length. Wikipedia

Lamponidae.label: Lamponidae
Lamponidae.description: The Lamponidae are a spider family with about 200 described species in 23 genera. Wikipedia

Long-legged sac spider.label: Long-legged sac spider
Long-legged sac spider.description:
The long-legged sac spiders include nearly 400 species in about 30 genera worldwide.
The largest genus currently recognized as belonging to this family is Cheiracanthium, which used to be placed in the family of "true" sac spider, Clubionidae. Wikipedia

Lycosoidea.label: Lycosoidea
Lycosoidea.description:
The Lycosoidea are a superfamily of araneomorph eight-eyed spiders, with twelve families
Ctenidae
Lycosidae
Neolanidae
Oxyopidae
Pisauridae
Psechridae
Senoculidae
Stiphidiidae
Trechaleidae
Zoridae ... Wikipedia

Nemesiidae.label: Nemesiidae
Nemesiidae.description: The Nemesiidae are a spider family of the infraorder Mygalomorphae, and the only member of the superfamily Nemesioidea. They were formerly considered part of the Dipluridae family. Wikipedia

Malkaridae.label: Malkaridae
Malkaridae.description: Malkaridae is a small spider family with ten species in four genera. Wikipedia

Mygalomorphae.label: Mygalomorphae
Mygalomorphae.description: The Mygalomorphae are an infraorder of spiders. The scientific name comes from the orientation of the fangs which point straight down and do not cross each other. Wikipedia

Nephilidae.label: Nephilidae
Nephilidae.description: The Nephilidae are a spider family with 75 described species in four genera. They were formerly grouped in the families Araneidae and Tetragnathidae. The genus Singafrotypa was moved to Araneidae in 2002. Wikipedia

Oonopidae.label: Oonopidae
Oonopidae.description: The spider family Oonopidae, commonly known as goblin spiders, includes over 2000 species in about 88 genera worldwide. The type genus of the family is Oonops Keyserling, 1835. They are generally tiny haplogyne araneomorph spiders. Wikipedia

Oecobiidae.label: Oecobiidae
Oecobiidae.description:
The spider family Oecobiidae includes about 100 described species so far.
The Oecobiidae are small- to moderate-sized spiders; The larger species tend to be desert-dwelling. Wikipedia

Opiliones.label: Opiliones
Opiliones.description: Opiliones are an order of arachnids commonly known as harvestmen. As of December 2011, over 6,500 species of harvestmen have been discovered worldwide, although the real number of extant species may exceed 10,000. Wikipedia

Orb-weaver spider.label: Orb-weaver spider
Orb-weaver spider.description: The typical orb-weaver spiders are the most common group of builders of spiral wheel-shaped webs often found in gardens, fields and forests. Wikipedia

Orsolobidae.label: Orsolobidae
Orsolobidae.description: The Orsolobidae are a six-eyed spider family with about 180 described species in 29 genera. They were separated from the Dysderidae. Several genera were transferred from the Oonopidae. Wikipedia

Palpigradi.label: Palpigradi
Palpigradi.description: A palpigrade, commonly known as a microwhip scorpion, is an invertebrate animal belonging to the order Palpigradi in the class Arachnida, in the subphylum Chelicerata of the phylum Arthropoda. Wikipedia

Paratropididae.label: Paratropididae
Paratropididae.description: The baldlegged spiders are a small spider family with eight species. They are mygalomomorphs more closely related to tarantulas and allies, than to most other 'web-building' spiders. Wikipedia

Philodromidae.label: Philodromidae
Philodromidae.description: Philodromidae is a family of spiders commonly known as philodromid crab spiders or running crab spiders. This family is superficially similar to the "true" crab spiders in the family Thomisidae. Wikipedia

Pholcidae.label: Pholcidae
Pholcidae.description:
Pholcidae, commonly known as cellar spiders, are a spider family in the suborder Araneomorphae.
Some species, especially Pholcus phalangioides, are commonly called daddy long-legs spider, granddaddy ... Wikipedia

Prodidomidae.label: Prodidomidae
Prodidomidae.description:
The Prodidomidae are a spider family with about 300 species in 31 genera. They are sometimes called Long-Spinneret Ground Spiders.
This family is part of the superfamily Gnaphosoidea. Wikipedia

Plectreurid spider.label: Plectreurid spider
Plectreurid spider.description: Plectreuridae, often called Plectreurid spiders, are a small spider family confined to the North American deserts and the island of Cuba. Only two living genera are known - the nominate genus Plectreurys and Kibramoa. Wikipedia

Psechridae.label: Psechridae
Psechridae.description:
The Psechridae are a family of spiders with about 50 species in two extant genera, recently revised by Bayer.
They belong to the "RTA" clade of spiders, spiders that all have a Retrolateral Tibial Apophysis on the male pedipalp. Wikipedia

Ray spider.label: Ray spider
Ray spider.description: The ray spiders are spiders most recognizable for their construction of cone-shaped webs. As of 2008, the family consists of 75 species in 12 genera. Wikipedia

Ricinulei.label: Ricinulei
Ricinulei.description: The Order Ricinulei is a group of arachnids known as hooded tickspiders. In older works they are sometimes referred to as Podogona. Wikipedia

Schizomida.label: Schizomida
Schizomida.description:
Schizomida is an order of arachnids, generally less than 5 millimetres in length.
The order is not yet widely studied. As of 2005, more than 230 species of schizomids have been described worldwide, most belonging to the Hubbardiidae family. Wikipedia

Sicariidae.label: Sicariidae
Sicariidae.description: Sicariidae is a family of six-eyed venomous spiders known for their necrotic bites. The members of this family are haplogyne, possessing unsclerotised genitals in females. Wikipedia

Senoculidae.label: Senoculidae
Senoculidae.description: Senoculidae is a spider family with 31 described species in one genus. They belong to the superfamily Lycosoidea. "Bark Hunter" is the common name used by researchers. Wikipedia

Metellina.label: Metellina
Metellina.description:
Metellina is a genus of tetragnathid spiders that occurs mostly in Eurasia, with two species found in North America. M. segmentata was introduced to Canada.
Some researchers consider this genus to belong to a distinct family, the Metidae. Wikipedia

Solifugae.label: Solifugae
Solifugae.description: Solifugae is an order of animals in the class Arachnida. They are known variously as camel spiders, wind scorpions, sun spiders, or solifuges. The order includes more than 1,000 described species in about 153 genera. Wikipedia

Telemidae.label: Telemidae
Telemidae.description: The Telemidae are a six-eyed spider family with 57 described species in seven genera, see here for details Wikipedia

Trapdoor spider.label: Trapdoor spider
Trapdoor spider.description: Trapdoor spiders are medium-sized mygalomorph spiders that construct burrows with a cork-like trapdoor made of soil, vegetation and silk. Wikipedia

Trechaleidae.label: Trechaleidae
Trechaleidae.description: The Trechaleidae are a spider family with 75 described species in 15 genera. Wikipedia

Tree trunk spider.label: Tree trunk spider
Tree trunk spider.description: The tree trunk spiders are members of the tropical and semi-tropical Family Hersiliidae. There are about 150 species in this family. These spiders have two very prominent spinnerets that are almost as long as their abdomen. Wikipedia

Uloboridae.label: Uloboridae
Uloboridae.description: Uloboridae, the cribellate orb weavers or hackled orb weavers, is a family of non-venomous spiders. Their lack of venom glands is a secondarily evolved trait. Instead, they kill their prey by crushing with over 140 metres of thread. Wikipedia

Mysmenidae.label: Mysmenidae
Mysmenidae.description: Mysmenidae is a spider family with almost 100 described species in more than twenty genera. Wikipedia

Synotaxidae.label: Synotaxidae
Synotaxidae.description: The Synotaxidae are a spider family with 68 described species in 13 genera. Wikipedia
